title: How to Make Beer Popsicles

steps.headline: Open one can of beer and pour it into a plastic party cup.
steps.description: Open each can only at the time you're making the popsicles, so that the beer doesn’t go flat or sit around too long.

steps.headline: Juice 1 lime directly into the cup.
steps.description: Roll the lime softly on the counter before cutting open, to help release the juices. When squeezing the lime into the beer, hold the lime with the skin in your palm and the cut end upward. That way you eliminate or reduce the likelihood that seeds will fall into your brew.

steps.headline: Add 1 teaspoon of agave nectar to the cup and mix well.
steps.description: Stir for up to 15 seconds to ensure that the lime juice and nectar permeate the entire drink.

steps.headline: Repeat for each popsicle you're making.
steps.description: This article has suggested six beer popsicles in all.

steps.headline: Place the beer cup(s) in the freezer.
steps.description: Allow the popsicle to freeze for at least 3 to 4 hours––overnight is best.

steps.headline: Remove the cup(s) from the freezer once the beer has frozen rock solid.
steps.description: You may want to test the beer by poking a small hole in the top with a toothpick or similar instrument. That way you can tell if the brew has frozen the entire way through yet.

steps.headline: Twist and slide the frozen beer from the party cup.
steps.description: It's now ready to serve. Enjoy.

tyn: 6 wooden sticks, skewers or plastic knives (dull blade)
6 plastic party cups (large enough to hold one can of beer)
text: Preparing the Popsicle Mixture Open one can of beer and pour it into a plastic party cup. Open each can only at the time you're making the popsicles, so that the beer doesn’t go flat or sit around too long. Juice 1 lime directly into the cup. Roll the lime softly on the counter before cutting open, to help release the juices. When squeezing the lime into the beer, hold the lime with the skin in your palm and the cut end upward. That way you eliminate or reduce the likelihood that seeds will fall into your brew. Add 1 teaspoon of agave nectar to the cup and mix well. Stir for up to 15 seconds to ensure that the lime juice and nectar permeate the entire drink. Repeat for each popsicle you're making. This article has suggested six beer popsicles in all. Freezing the Popsicles Place the beer cup(s) in the freezer. Allow the popsicle to freeze for at least 3 to 4 hours––overnight is best. Remove the cup(s) from the freezer once the beer has frozen rock solid. You may want to test the beer by poking a small hole in the top with a toothpick or similar instrument. That way you can tell if the brew has frozen the entire way through yet. Serving the Popsicles Twist and slide the frozen beer from the party cup. It's now ready to serve. Enjoy. Finished.
